page.title: 19Farming (3)
page.content: Farmers in 1985 do not have a very good public image. They are generally blamed for the loss of hedges and the replacement of a patchwork field system by dreary monoculture over thousands of acres. Small farmers in this area recognise this image but are not a part of it. They do care for the conservation of the land, and do tolerate the deprivations of wildlife to a certain extent. This area is fortunate in not having that class of 'agri-businessman' that cares nothing for the countryside, and despoils it for profit. Most farmers we spoke to seemed moderately content with their lot. They realised that their land was worth a great deal of money if sold, but did not know what they would do without it.
